|action2=WAR |action2date=21:38, 24 October 2014 (UTC) |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Peter Raw |action2result=approved |action2oldid=630506382 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Biography|living=no|class=A|military-work-group=yes|military-priority=low|listas=Raw, Peter}} {{MILHIST|class=A|b1=y|b2=y|b3=y|b4=y|b5=y|Biography=y|ANZSP=y|WWII=y |Cold-War=y|A-Class=pass}} {{WikiProject Australia|military=yes|class=A|importance=Low|military-importance=mid}} {{WikiProject Aviation|Biography=yes|class=A|b1=y|b2=y|b3=y|b4=y|b5=y}} }}
==Substantive Gp Capt== Hi Nick, minor point but while skimming through old copies of ''RAAF News'' I saw a notice that Raw was made substantive group captain in November 1965, rather than May 1966, as suggested here. Are you able to double-check ''Wartime''? BTW, was there anything holding you back from nominating this for GA, 'cos I think it's sufficiently detailed... Cheers, [[User:Ian Rose|Ian Rose]] ([[User talk:Ian Rose|talk]]) 11:23, 29 April 2013 (UTC) :Thanks Ian I'll double check. This is on my to-do list for GA status - it needs a copy edit. Regards, [[User:Nick-D|Nick-D]] ([[User talk:Nick-D|talk]]) 08:33, 1 May 2013 (UTC) ::Belatedly checked: the article says that he became an acting group captain in February 1965, and was confirmed at this rank in January 1966. [[User:Nick-D|Nick-D]] ([[User talk:Nick-D|talk]]) 11:20, 19 June 2013 (UTC)
== Image ==
I found [http://www.awm.gov.au/collection/MALTA0003/ this] copyright expired image of Raw in the AWM collections that you might like to use, Nick. :) Cheers, [[User:Abraham, B.S.|Abraham, B.S.]] ([[User talk:Abraham, B.S.|talk]]) 05:47, 20 June 2013 (UTC) :Thanks! I've just uploaded this. Thanks also for pointing out the ADB entry - it's part of the recent expansion, and I didn't realise that it existed. [[User:Nick-D|Nick-D]] ([[User talk:Nick-D|talk]]) 08:43, 20 June 2013 (UTC) ::No problem. :) I found the same thing with my recent article on [[Alan McNicoll]]; when I started writing it in my sandbox a couple of years ago he had no ADB entry, but when I returned to finish it off the other month I discovered one now existed! Cheers, [[User:Abraham, B.S.|Abraham, B.S.]] ([[User talk:Abraham, B.S.|talk]]) 03:42, 21 June 2013 (UTC)
== Proposed rewording re Long Tan ==
Gday. This article mentions the [[Battle of Long Tan]] in a few places in the context of Raw's involvement, using the word "ambush" to describe it. Yet whether or not D Coy, 6 RAR was ambushed at Long Tan has been debated widely since the battle and the official history describes it as a "meeting engagement" or "encounter battle". From reviewing the source used for this article (Stephens 1995 ''Going Solo'') this language (i.e. "ambush) doesn't seem to have been used either (unless I missed it). Anyway, this is discussed in all too much detail in the wiki article on the battle itself if anyone is interested. As such I propose rewording this slightly to something like "surrounded and heavily engaged" instead of "ambushed" etc. Are there any objections to this or other suggestions / comments? Thanks. [[User:Anotherclown|Anotherclown]] ([[User talk:Anotherclown|talk]]) 23:53, 20 September 2014 (UTC) :That sounds highly sensible to me (as I understand it, the current general view is that it was a meeting engagement) [[User:Nick-D|Nick-D]] ([[User talk:Nick-D|talk]]) 23:58, 20 September 2014 (UTC) :: Cheers for sorting that Nick. I amended the lead to reflect the amended text of the article. Pls let me know if you think that doesn't work. Thanks again. [[User:Anotherclown|Anotherclown]] ([[User talk:Anotherclown|talk]]) 00:21, 21 September 2014 (UTC) :::G'day, gents, just saw these changes - I also think this is a sensible approach. Great work. Regards, [[User:AustralianRupert|AustralianRupert]] ([[User talk:AustralianRupert|talk]]) 00:25, 21 September 2014 (UTC)
